alert.note: Alert for Clatsop; Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 5:06PM PST until January 08 at 1:04PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Willapa River near Willapa affecting Pacific County. Naselle River near Naselle affecting Pacific and Wahkiakum Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Washington... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Tillamook and Clatsop Counties. Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nehalem River near Foss. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 20.0 feet, flooding of some buildings in the town of Nehalem begins, with the situation worsening during the high tide. Also expect widespread low land flooding and numerous flooded rural roads from the Foss gauge station downstream to Nehalem. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM PST Thursday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest just above moderate flood stage at 20 feet early Friday. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later tonight.
